questions.question: I heard the song ………………. the radio?
questions.description: We use on with radio and television.

questions.question: Identify the kind of sentence: Have a nice day.
questions.description: An imperative sentence is a command, prayer, request or wish.

questions.question: Mount Everest is ……………………. peak in the world.
questions.description: The superlative is used with the.

questions.question: If I had a car, I ……………………. you a lift.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a simple past tense in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: Please write ……………………
questions.description: Legible is an adjective legibly is the adverb.

questions.question: She asked me why …………………….. crying.
questions.description: The subject goes before the auxiliary verb in reported questions.

questions.question: …………………… their best efforts, they could not save him.
questions.description: Despite or in spite of is correct here.

questions.question: They failed to properly ………………….. her illness.
He rarely visits you, ……………………?
questions.description: Non-negative tags are used after negative expressions like rarely or hardly.

questions.question: What does the expression ‘devil’s advocate’ mean?
It is high time you ……………………. up smoking.
questions.description: We use a past tense after it is time with a present meaning.
